name: Juvenile Detention Education
objective: The Juvenile Detention Education Program was designed to provide education services to detained and incarcerated youth in the 24 Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) funded juvenile detention centers (JDCs)

results.description: Indian Affairs fulfilled its program objectives by awarding approximately three (3) Self-Determination Awards in FY 2020
Indian Affairs  issued 1 new awards and modifications to existing awards to 1 recipients.
This award funded 1 program for education in adult and juvenile detention centers.

authorizations.text: Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act, Public Law 93-638, as amended, 25 U.S.C. 450 et seq.; Public Law 103-413, Title II Tribal Self- Governance Act; Indian Education Amendments of 1978, Public Law 95-561, 25 U.S.C. 2001 et seq.; Tribally Controlled Schools Act, 25 U.S.C. 2501 et seq.

rules_regulations: A copy of the guidelines may be obtained by contacting the BIE Education Line Officers.
